data.text: The act of moving from place to place.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The ability to move from place to place.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Movement from place to place; progressive motion, as of a living being or a vehicle; the act of moving from point to point; also, the capability of moving in this manner.
The act of moving from place to place.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: The power of moving from place to place, characteristic of the higher animals and some of the lower forms of plant life.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: The name of a song and a dance, briefly popular in the 1960's.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: The <xref>ability</xref> to <xref>move</xref> from place to place, or the act of doing so.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: <xref>Self</xref>-<xref>powered</xref> <xref>motion</xref> by which a whole <xref>organism</xref> changes its <xref>location</xref> through <xref>walking</xref>, <xref>running</xref>, <xref>jumping</xref>, <xref>crawling</xref>, <xref>swimming</xref> or <xref>flying</xref>.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.
from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.

data.text: the power or ability to move
data.attributionText: from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.
